707604f-a.text:
First Avenue (extreme left) and vicinity, southward from E. 41st Street and Prospect Place (in Tudor City), showing across tenement roofs the Electo Company warehouse under construction on the westerly Avenue frontage from 39th to 38th Streets. On the opposite side of this thoroughfare i the New York Edison Company power hose. From this new building the United Parcel Service will distribute the majority of purchases made in local department stores, surplanting similar individual functions. It was this structure that necessitated various changes in plans for the 38th Street East River Tunnel and which finally emerged to the south of same.
October 26, 1928.
P.L. Sperr

707605f-a.text:
Tudor City, First Avenue, west side,from 41st to 43rd Street.
March 5, 1928.
New York Edison Company Collection.

712705f-a.text:
(1)
41st Street, south side, west from No. 330 between First and
Second Avenues.
May 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, not showing much beyond Second Avenue. The Tudor City development has begun, and most of the old houses have
been demolished.
January 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
